2009/12/8 Wesley Tansey <tansey@...>
>
> Maybe I'm missing something, but would the search space reduction (in terms of range of
> valid weight values) really lend to improved search?

Probably not because the underlying fitness landscape is still the
same but is now quantized, which can disrupt hill-climbing like
algorithms (you might get stuck on a step of a hillside). However,
providing that the quantization isn't too extreme you get a working
NEAT search with a decent performance boost - so for a given problem
domain there will be a sweet spot.

Colin.
